page.title: 18BOULDISH FARM ESTATE, ASCOT.
page.content:
{Bouldish Farm Estate}was built between 1954 and 1956. It was the first{council estate}in the Windsor Rural District to have its own shops. It was constructed on land that was originally privately owned and worked as a farm.
The majority of{buildings}are two-storey terraces which contain four to six dwellings. They have small front gardens and long plots at the rear. Car parking is on the street as there are no garages. There are some semi-detached houses and some two- storey flats also. Most of these properties are rented from the Council. There has been some{modern} {development}of three-storey blocks of flats and semi-detached houses to the south of the main estate. This area has garages and more open space.
